metadata.title: CVE-2018-19790 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An open redirect was discovered in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.50, 2.8.x before 2.8.49, 3.x before 3.4.20, 4.0.x before 4.0.15, 4.1.x before 4.1.9 and 4.2.x before 4.2.1. By using backslashes in the `_failure_path` input field of login forms, an attacker can work around the redirection target restrictions and effectively redirect the user to any domain after login.

criterions.comment: symfony package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.20+dfsg-1').
